text: <https://youtu.be/ZvMYCj-B_nA?t=660> Peter Wang, creator of Anaconda, mentioned Julia in this interview just before being interrupted :pensive:

attachments.title: Peter Wang on Anaconda, Python and Scientific Computing

elements.text: Peter Wang, creator of Anaconda, mentioned Julia in this interview just before being interrupted

text: The interviewer doesn't seem to be particularly interested. He glossed over Peter Norvig's praise of Julia and hurriedly moved on when Jeremy Howard was talking about it.

elements.text: The interviewer doesn't seem to be particularly interested. He glossed over Peter Norvig's praise of Julia and hurriedly moved on when Jeremy Howard was talking about it.

text: I want to be charitable and say it's a limitation of the virtual format, but it really does feel like wilful ignorance.

elements.text: I want to be charitable and say it's a limitation of the virtual format, but it really does feel like wilful ignorance.

text: oh, it's always the same interviewer?

elements.text: oh, it's always the same interviewer?

text: At least for those 3 it was

elements.text: At least for those 3 it was

text: Maybe a bunch of YT comments could help for future interviews? (or it could make clear that he doesn't care)

elements.text: Maybe a bunch of YT comments could help for future interviews? (or it could make clear that he doesn't care)

text: In one of those interviews the interviewer said something that made it clear he had no idea at all what Julia is (can't recall the statement). He didn't sound exactly hostile, but not so interested, either.

elements.text: In one of those interviews the interviewer said something that made it clear he had no idea at all what Julia is (can't recall the statement). He didn't sound exactly hostile, but not so interested, either.

text: Hence wilful ignorance. I think even many who rant on Julia threads on HN have at least taken the time to _look_ at the language.

elements.text: Hence wilful ignorance. I think even many who rant on Julia threads on HN have at least taken the time to

text: Just before that, Peter Wang mentioned languages that combined Lisp & Fortran.  The k / Q languages he was talking about might be interesting.

elements.text: Just before that, Peter Wang mentioned languages that combined Lisp & Fortran.  The k / Q languages he was talking about might be interesting.

text: Peter seems very unbiased when talking about the pros/cons of different languages in different circumstances.

elements.text: Peter seems very unbiased when talking about the pros/cons of different languages in different circumstances.

text: From a number of comments during the podcast, I think he’s really a schemehead (like Jeff!)

elements.text: From a number of comments during the podcast, I think he’s really a schemehead (like Jeff!)
